text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm oer A Cloud support engineer
at the AWS office in Cape Town today I'm
going to show you how to change the
primary private IP address of your
Amazon elastic compute Cloud instance
let's get started when you launch an ec2
instance in a subnet the instance
receives a primary private IP address
from that subnets ipv4 address range if
you don't specify an IP address an
available IP is automatically assigned
but you can't directly change this
primary private IP address after the
instance is launched the IP remains
associated with the instance's network
interface until you terminate the
instance there is a way to get a new
instance with the desired private IP
here are steps
first let's create an Amazon machine
image of your existing instance navigate
to ec2 console select the
instance choose
actions choose image and
templates and then choose create image
follow the prompts to create the
Ami this Ami will contain contain all
the software and data from your original
instance after you create the Ami
terminate that original instance so that
the private IP address of that instance
is available next launch a new instance
from this Ami navigate to the instances
console choose launch
instances then select the Ami that you
just created
when configuring instance details choose
edit network
settings be sure that you enter the same
subnet value as your original
instance then expand the advanced
network configuration
section here you can specify the primary
private IP you want under primary IP
complete the remaining launch
steps and your new instance will have
the custom primary private IP that you
specified or if you have an existing
instance with the desired private IP you
can also exchange that ip4 a new
instance first change the network
interfaces termination Behavior to
prevent it from deletion navigate to
network
interfaces select the
interface choose
actions and then change termination
Behavior clear the delete on termination
checkbox next create an Ami from the
instance with the IP that you want
then terminate that original
instance finally launch a new instance
from the Ami
when you configure the network settings
be sure that you choose the same VPC and
subnet as your original
instance if the network interface of the
instance has a public IP address
assigned along with the private IP
address address then you must turn off
the setting Auto assign public IP under
network settings next remove any
assigned security groups under network
settings section because you can't
select a security group and then select
an already existing network interface
next expand Advanced network
configuration and then select that
network interface from the terminated
instance this action assigns the new
instance that same primary private
IP and now you know how to change the
primary private IP address of your
Amazon ec2
instance thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
